alert.note: Alert for Bradley; Calhoun; Union (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 17 at 11:26AM CDT until June 22 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Arkansas... Ouachita River At Thatcher L&D affecting Bradley, Union and Calhoun Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ouachita River At Thatcher L&D. * WHEN...Until Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 80.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs at this level. Levee gates should be closed to prevent the river from backing into Calion Lake. Access to oil and gas rigs and to timber is flooded. There is wide coverage of flooding in the river bottoms. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Friday the stage was 81.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is currently cresting at 81.2 feet. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 79.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 1 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Crest Time Date Ouachita River Thatcher L&D 79.0 81.2 Fri 10 AM 81.0 80.5 79.8 CRESTING &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
